name: Standing Overhead Dummbell Press
notes: This is a warmup exercise. Use light weights (5, 10, 15lbs), and focus on form, using one arm at a time
Dumbbells should come down to your ears, with your elbows pointed down -- all the way to bringing your bicep to your ear. Focus on form
Bring the dumbbells down, breath in. Push up, breath out. It may be helpful to cross your opposite arm against your chest

name: Dumbbell Front Raise
notes: This is a warmup exercise. Use light weights (5, 10, 15lbs), and focus on form, using one arm at a time
Stand with your feed shoulder-width apart, toes pointed forward
Do not swing the dumbbell back and forth -- the dumbbell should come to a complete stop on both the upswing and downswing
Exhale when you push the dumbbell forward and up -- breath in bringing it down. Try and bring it down slowly

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
notes: This is a warmup exercise. Use light weights (5, 10, 15lbs), and focus on form, using one arm at a time
Stand with your feed shoulder-width apart, toes pointed forward
Do not swing the dumbbell back and forth -- the dumbbell should come to a complete stop on both the upswing and downswing
Exhale when you push the dumbbell to the side and up -- breath in bringing it down. Try and bring it down slowly

name: Dumbbell Lunge
notes: Do the listed number of reps per-leg
This is a warmup exercise. Use light weights (5, 10, 15lbs), and focus on form, using one arm at a time
Keep the dumbbells to your side, stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, toes pointing forward
Take a long step and bend with your rear knee -- both your front and rear knees should form a 90-degree (right) angle
When pushing up, focus on using the mid-back of your feet to push yourself up
Inhale while bending, and exhale when standing

name: Dumbbell/Kettlebell Sumo Squat
notes: Hold the weight slightly below chest level
Legs should be a little wider than shoulder width, pointed slightly outward
When pushing up, focus on using the mid-back of your feet to push yourself up. You shouldn't fall, but if you do, try to fall backwards
Inhale while bending, and exhale when pushing up to stand
